questions.text: Kirchhoff's Voltage Law (KVL) is based on the conservation of:
The Thevenin equivalent voltage (Vth) is:

choices.text: The short-circuit voltage across the terminals
The open-circuit voltage across the terminals
The voltage across the Thevenin resistance
The total voltage supplied by the source

questions.text: In a purely resistive AC circuit, the phase angle between voltage and current is:
A semiconductor in its purest form is called:
Which of the following is essential for an oscillator circuit to start and sustain oscillations?

choices.text: Positive feedback with a loop gain of exactly one

questions.text: Which amplifier class offers the highest efficiency but has the most distortion?
The 2's complement of the binary number 10110 is:
A logic gate whose output is HIGH only when all its inputs are HIGH is called:
A flip-flop that changes its state on the rising or falling edge of a clock pulse is known as:
The register in a CPU that holds the address of the next instruction to be executed is the:
Which standard is commonly used for serial communication?
An interrupt that can be temporarily ignored by the processor is a:
In C, what is the primary purpose of the volatile keyword?

choices.text: To declare a variable whose value cannot be changed.
To tell the compiler that a variable's value may change at any time without any action being taken by the code the compiler finds nearby.
To create a variable that is visible only within the file it is declared in.

questions.text: Which of the following correctly describes a union in C?

choices.text: It stores multiple values of different types simultaneously.
It is a way to group multiple variables of the same type.
It allocates a shared memory space for all its members, so only one member can hold a value at any given time.
It is another name for a structure.

questions.text: In C++, a constructor that does not take any arguments is called a:
The ability of an object to take on many forms is a key feature of OOP known as:
What is the primary function of Direct Memory Access (DMA)?

choices.text: To allow the CPU to access memory faster.
To allow I/O devices to access main memory directly, bypassing the CPU.
To execute arithmetic and logical operations.

questions.text: A CISC (Complex Instruction Set Computer) architecture emphasizes:

choices.text: A small set of simple, fixed-length instructions.
A large, rich set of instructions that can perform complex tasks in a single step.

questions.text: Cache memory works on the principle of:
Which of the following is a key characteristic of an embedded system?

choices.text: It is designed to perform a dedicated function or a specific set of functions.
It always requires a graphical user interface (GUI).
It primarily uses secondary storage like hard disks.

questions.text: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for routing packets from a source to a destination across multiple networks?
What is the purpose of the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)?

choices.text: To resolve a domain name to an IP address.
To resolve an IP address to a MAC address.

questions.text: Which transport layer protocol provides connection-oriented, reliable data transfer?
A firewall is a network security device that:

choices.text: Monitors and filters incoming and outgoing network traffic based on security rules.
Detects and removes viruses from computers.
Assigns IP addresses to devices on a network.

questions.text: A Non-deterministic Finite Automaton (NFA) is different from a Deterministic Finite Automaton (DFA) because an NFA:

choices.text: Cannot have more than one final state.
Can have multiple possible next states for a given input symbol and state.
Does not have a start state.

questions.text: In the context of formal languages, a grammar is defined by:

choices.text: A set of terminals, a set of non-terminals, a start symbol, and a set of production rules.
Only a set of terminals and non-terminals.
A set of states and transitions.

questions.text: The Cohen-Sutherland algorithm is used for:
Which display technology works by exciting a gas plasma to emit light?
Which of the following is a linear data structure?
What is the worst-case time complexity of a binary search algorithm?
In SQL, which command is used to add, delete, or modify columns in an existing table?
A situation where two or more processes are waiting indefinitely for an event that can only be caused by one of the waiting processes is known as:
The 'Agile Model' of software development focuses on:

choices.text: Comprehensive documentation as the primary goal.
Iterative development and collaboration with the customer.
A final 'big bang' release after years of development.

questions.text: Which type of software testing is performed by the end-user in their own environment?
In object-oriented analysis, a 'Use Case' describes:

choices.text: The internal structure of a class.
An interaction between a user (actor) and the system to achieve a goal.
The inheritance hierarchy of the system.

questions.text: Which UML diagram is best suited for modeling the sequence of messages exchanged between objects over time?
In the context of AI, a 'rational agent' is one that:

choices.text: Always makes the morally correct decision.
Acts to achieve the best expected outcome based on its knowledge.
Is purely based on simple reflexes.

questions.text: The A* search algorithm is an example of:
Which of the following is an example of unsupervised machine learning?

choices.text: Classifying emails as spam or not spam using labeled examples.
Predicting house prices based on historical sales data.
Grouping customers into distinct clusters based on their purchasing behavior without prior labels.
A chess-playing program that learns from winning and losing.

questions.text: The function of an activation function in a neural network is to:

choices.text: Initialize the weights of the network.
Introduce non-linearity into the output of a neuron.
Calculate the loss of the network.

questions.text: In engineering drawings, an isometric projection is a type of:
The Net Present Value (NPV) method in engineering economics helps in:

choices.text: Calculating the depreciation of an asset.
Determining the profitability of an investment by considering the time value of money.

questions.text: A critical path in a PERT chart is the sequence of tasks that:

choices.text: Is the shortest path through the network.
Contains all the most expensive tasks.
Determines the minimum time to complete the project.
Has the most slack or float time.

questions.text: Professional ethics in engineering primarily ensures:

choices.text: The safety, health, and welfare of the public.
The use of the most advanced technology in all projects.
That engineers only work on government projects.

questions.text: Which of the following is a primary role of the Nepal Engineers' Association (NEA)?

choices.text: To license engineers to practice in Nepal.
To act as a professional organization for the welfare and advancement of its members.
To set the national budget for engineering projects.
To directly manage all construction in the country.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a constructor in C++?

choices.text: To initialize the data members of an object when it is created
To copy the contents of one object to another

questions.text: The logical OR operation is performed by which of the following gates?
Which of the following is NOT a property of a transaction (ACID)?
Pipelining in a CPU is a technique used to:

choices.text: Increase the number of instructions executed per unit of time

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT an application layer protocol?
The pumping lemma for regular languages is used to prove that:

choices.text: A given language is not regular
A given language is not context-free

questions.text: A binary tree where the height difference between the left and right subtrees of any node is at most 1 is called:
In software engineering, what is refactoring?

choices.text: Rewriting code to add new functionality
Restructuring existing computer code without changing its external behavior

questions.text: Bayesian networks are primarily used for:

choices.text: Representing knowledge and reasoning under uncertainty

questions.text: The Interest Rate of Return (IRR) is the discount rate at which:
The memory that requires periodic refreshing to maintain its data is:
In a relational database, a foreign key is a field that:

choices.text: Uniquely identifies a record in a table
Links to the primary key of another table
Is not allowed to be NULL

questions.text: The process of converting source code into machine code is done by a:
Which of the following is a characteristic of a real-time operating system (RTOS)?

choices.text: It is primarily used for desktop computers.
It provides a fast response time to events within a strict time constraint.
It supports a wide range of general-purpose applications.
It has a complex graphical user interface.

questions.text: According to the Nepal Engineering Council Act, registration is mandatory for:

choices.text: Anyone with an interest in engineering

questions.text: A series RLC circuit has R = 10 Ω, L = 0.1 H, and C = 10 µF. The resonant frequency (in rad/s) is:
Simplify the Boolean expression F(A, B, C) = A'BC + AB'C + ABC' + ABC using a Karnaugh map.
A computer has a 32-bit address bus. What is the maximum amount of memory it can address?
An IP network uses the address 192.168.1.0 with a subnet mask of 255.255.255.224. How many usable host addresses are available per subnet?
A point (4, 3) is rotated counter-clockwise by an angle of 90 degrees about the origin. What are the new coordinates?

Consider a hash table of size 10 using the hash function h(k) = k mod 10. What is the state of the table after inserting the keys 23, 44, 32, 53, 42, assuming linear probing is used to resolve collisions?
What is the post-order traversal of a binary search tree whose in-order traversal is "5, 10, 12, 15, 18" and pre-order traversal is "15, 10, 5, 12, 18"?

In a paging system, a process has a page table with the following entries: Page 0 -> Frame 5, Page 1 -> Frame 8, Page 2 -> Frame 2. If the page size is 1024 bytes, what is the physical address corresponding to the logical address 2200?

A project has an initial investment of Rs. 100,000 and is expected to generate cash inflows of Rs. 30,000 per year for 5 years. If the discount rate is 10%, is the project acceptable based on the NPV rule? (PV factor for 5 years at 10% is 3.791)
What will the following SQL query return? SELECT Department, COUNT(*) FROM Employees WHERE Salary > 50000 GROUP BY Department HAVING COUNT(*) > 3;

choices.text: All departments with more than 3 employees.
Departments where more than 3 employees have a salary greater than 50000.
The total count of employees with a salary over 50000.
The names of employees in departments with more than 3 people.

questions.text: What is the correct regular expression for a language over {a, b} that accepts all strings starting with 'a' and ending with 'b'?
What is the purpose of the super keyword in object-oriented programming (like Java or C#)?

choices.text: To refer to the current object instance.
To call a method or constructor of the immediate parent class.
To declare a method that cannot be overridden.

questions.text: In machine learning, what is 'overfitting'?

choices.text: When a model performs poorly on the training data.
When a model performs very well on the training data but poorly on new, unseen data.
When a model is too simple to capture the underlying pattern of the data.
The process of selecting the best features for a model.

questions.text: A 4-bit synchronous counter is built using JK flip-flops. What is the maximum number it can count up to?
Which of the following is an example of a functional requirement for a library management system?

choices.text: The system must be easy to use.
The system should be able to handle 100 concurrent users.
The system shall allow a librarian to issue a book to a member.
The system database must be secured against unauthorized access.

questions.text: What is the Hamming distance between the binary codes 101101 and 111001?
Consider the First-Come, First-Served (FCFS) scheduling algorithm. If processes P1, P2, and P3 arrive at time 0 with burst times of 24, 3, and 3 respectively, what is the average waiting time?
What is the primary purpose of normalization in database design?

choices.text: To reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity.
To create a denormalized schema for reporting.
